etymology.description: 浴(浴) (yù, "bathe") refers to the act of washing or immersing oneself in water, while 巾(巾) (jīn, "towel") refers to a cloth used to dry oneself.
etymology.interpretation: A 浴巾(浴巾) (yùjīn, "bath towel") is a towel specifically intended for use after bathing, designed to absorb water from the body.

examples.chinese: 我用浴巾擦干头发(我用浴巾擦乾頭髮)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yòng yùjīn cā gān tóufà.
examples.english: I use the bath towel to dry my hair.

examples.chinese: 洗完澡后(洗完澡後)，用浴巾擦干身体(用浴巾擦乾身體)。
examples.pinyin: Xǐ wán zǎo hòu, yòng yùjīn cā gān shēntǐ.
examples.english: After bathing, use the bath towel to dry your body.

examples.chinese: 他忘记(他忘記)，把浴巾放在椅子上(把浴巾放在椅子上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wàngjì, bǎ yùjīn fàng zài yǐzi shàng.
examples.english: He forgot to bring the bath towel and left it on the chair.
